name: JAPANESE ENCEPHALITIS VACCINE
side-effects: Side-effects see section 14.1; also less commonly migraine, vertigo, pharyngolaryngeal pain
pregnancy:
Pregnancy although manufacturer advises avoid because of limited
information, miscarriage has been associated with Japanese encephalitis
virus infection acquired during the first 2 trimesters of pregnancy

name: JAPANESE ENCEPHALITIS VACCINE  - JAPANESE ENCEPHALITIS VACCINE
side-effects: Side-effects see section 14.1; also less commonly migraine, vertigo, pharyngolaryngeal pain
doses:
by intramuscular injection in deltoid region, adult over 18 years 2 doses of 0.5 mL separated by
interval of 28 days; booster dose 1–2 years after completing primary
course, but for those at continued risk the booster dose should be
given 1 year after completing the primary course
pregnancy:
Pregnancy although manufacturer advises avoid because of limited
information, miscarriage has been associated with Japanese encephalitis
virus infection acquired during the first 2 trimesters of pregnancy
